intro: Medinilla coriacea, commonly known as the rough medinilla, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are thick, leathery, and have a rough texture, giving it its common name. The flowers are usually pink or white, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the rainy season.
